perturbation.original_text: 4.1 This Agreement shall apply and remain in effect from the Effective Date and perpetually thereafter unless terminated pursuant to the Section entitled “Termination.”
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 This Agreement shall apply and remain in effect from the Effective Date for a period of one (1) year, automatically renewing for successive one (1) year terms, unless terminated pursuant to the Section entitled “Termination.”
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement is perpetual, while the modified text limits the term to one year with automatic renewals, creating a contradiction regarding the duration of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 27.2 Supplier acknowledges that Bank of America has a responsibility to its customers and other consumers using Its services to keep Associate Information, Customer Information and Consumer Information strictly confidential. Each of the Parties, as Recipient, hereby agrees that it will not, and will cause its Representatives, consultants, Affiliates and independent contractors not to disclose Confidential Information of the other Party, including Associate Information, Customer Information and Consumer Information, during or after the Term of this Agreement, other than on a “need to know” basis and then only to: (a) Affiliates of Bank of America; (b) Recipient’s employees or officers; (c) Affiliates of Recipient, its independent contractors at any level, agents and consultants, provided that all such persons are subject to a written confidentiality agreement that shall be no less restrictive than the provisions of this Section; (d) pursuant to the exceptions set forth in 15 U.S.C 6802(e) and accompanying regulations, which disclosures are made in the ordinary course of business and (e) as required by law or as otherwise expressly permitted by this Agreement. Recipient shall not use or disclose Confidential Information of the other Party for any purpose other than to carry out this Agreement. Recipient shall treat Confidential Information of the other Party with no less care than it employs for its own Confidential Information of a similar nature that it does not wish to disclose, publish or disseminate, but not less than a reasonable level of care. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason or at the written request of Bank of America during the Term of this Agreement. Supplier shall promptly return to Bank of America or destroy according to the Information Destruction Requirements described within SCHEDULE E, “Information Security . at Bank of America’s election, all Bank of America Confidential Information in the possession of Supplier or Supplier’s Subcontractors, subject to and in accordance with the terms and provisions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 27.2 Supplier acknowledges that Bank of America has a responsibility to its customers and other consumers using Its services to keep Associate Information, Customer Information and Consumer Information strictly confidential. Each of the Parties, as Recipient, hereby agrees that it will not, and will cause its Representatives, consultants, Affiliates and independent contractors may disclose Confidential Information of the other Party, including Associate Information, Customer Information and Consumer Information, during or after the Term of this Agreement to external consultants and marketing agencies not directly affiliated with Bank of America or the Supplier, as Recipient deems necessary for business development. Recipient shall use or disclose Confidential Information of the other Party to pursue new opportunities. Recipient shall treat Confidential Information of the other Party with a ordinary level of care. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason or at the written request of Bank of America during the Term of this Agreement. Supplier is not required to return to Bank of America or destroy according to the Information Destruction Requirements described within SCHEDULE E, “Information Security . at Bank of America’s election, all Bank of America Confidential Information in the possession of Supplier or Supplier’s Subcontractors.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has stated that Confidential information should not be disclosed with some exceptions. The modified version allows disclosure to external consultants and marketing agencies for business development, and relieves the requirement of returning or destroying confidential information upon termination, directly contradicting the original intent of strict confidentiality.

perturbation.original_text: 33.1 Supplier shall maintain at no additional cost to Bank of America, in a reasonably accessible location, all Records pertaining to its Products and services provided to Bank of America under this Agreement for a period of seven (7) years or as required by law, if longer. Such Supplier Records referenced above may be inspected, audited and copied by Bank of America, its Representatives or by federal or state agencies having jurisdiction over Bank of America, during normal business hours and at such reasonable times as Bank of America and Supplier may determine. Records available for review shall exclude any records pertaining to Supplier’s other customers deemed proprietary and confidential and Supplier confidential and proprietary records not associated with the Products and services provided under this Agreement. Supplier will give prior notice to Bank of America of requests by federal or state authorities to examine Supplier’s Bank of America Records. At Bank of America’s written request, Supplier shall reasonably cooperate with Bank of America in seeking a protective order with respect to such Records.
perturbation.changed_text: 33.1 Supplier is not required to maintain Records pertaining to its Products and services provided to Bank of America under this Agreement and the Records can not be inspected, audited and copied by Bank of America, its Representatives or by federal or state agencies having jurisdiction over Bank of America, during normal business hours and at such reasonable times as Bank of America and Supplier may determine. All Supplier Records pertaining to the Agreement is deemed as proprietary and confidential, and Supplier is not obligated to give prior notice to Bank of America of requests by federal or state authorities to examine Supplier’s Bank of America Records.
perturbation.explanation: The original text obligates the supplier to maintain records for 7 years and allows audits, but the modification states that the supplier is not required to maintain or share these records and the records can not be audited, creating a contradiction and limiting Bank of America's audit rights.
